title: Alternative to Linotype Brown font
content:
Hello!

I am looking for nice looking Sans font that could replace Lineto Brown ( [http://lineto.com/The%20Fonts/Font%20Categories/Text%20Fonts/Brown/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090200/http:/lineto.com/The%20Fonts/Font%20Categories/Text%20Fonts/Brown/ "http://lineto.com/The%20Fonts/Font%20Categories/Text%20Fonts/Brown/")) for a website project. Any suggestion welcome.
author: nic_-_mic

comments.content: Sorry for the mistake in the title
Franklin and News Gothic both have some of the same feel as Brown

Thanks for the suggestion! I was already thinking about Franklin too, and News looks very decent as well. The problem relies a lot around that different kind of "a" (I don't know how it's called). It gives the Brown type a "Futura/retro" feel. Also, I don't want to use futura as I have been using it waaay too much in my recent projects...
Whatwhatwhat? Neither Franklin Gothic nor News Gothic is anything like LL Brown.
He was looking for a nice looking sans - I did not think he wanted a clone.

Well, "that could replace" doesn't exactly mean "anything goes"...  
And you _did_ say "same feel"...

hhp
Maybe Proxima Nova, using the alternate monocular 'a'?
So Hrant, have you ever really looked at Franklin Gothic and News Gothic - feel is different than same as, and may be a more personal response.
Thank's a lot guys. Proxima nova seems nice. But, I'll have to find out if the alternative "a" can bet set in a web font context. Hmmmm, something tells me you can't...

Why can’t you use LL Brown? [http://lineto.com/Lineto.com/Lineto+Webfonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090200/http:/lineto.com/Lineto.com/Lineto+Webfonts/ "http://lineto.com/Lineto.com/Lineto+Webfonts/")
Don’t forget the [Brown](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/brown/) from which Lineto plagiarized the name of its typeface.
